    • Method Detail

      • attemptLock

        ILockInformation attemptLock(ILockInformation lockInformation)
                      throws LockFailureException
        Attempts to lock the passed instance. Return null if the lock could not be obtained due to various locking exception including but not limited to a primary key violation.
        Parameters:
        lockInformation - lock information of the lock to be attempted on
        Returns:
        information about the acquired lock, or null if we could not get it
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is any problem during locking

      • findExistingLockInstance

        ILockInformation findExistingLockInstance(java.lang.String aLockName)
                                   throws LockFailureException
        Gets the a current lock instance from the database/hazelcast cluster.
        Parameters:
        aLockName - name of the desired lock
        Returns:
        information about the lock instance, if one exists; otherwise, null
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if something goes wrong

      • updateLock

        boolean updateLock(ILockInformation existingLock,
                   ILockInformation newLock)
            throws LockFailureException
        Updates a lock instance.
        Parameters:
        existingLock - existing lock instance whose information should be updated
        newLock - new lock instance with the information to be updated
        Returns:
        information about the new lock, or null if we could not update the lock (because it disappeared)
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is a database problem

      • releaseLock

        ILockProvider.LockStatus releaseLock(java.lang.String aLockName,
                                     java.lang.String requestorId,
                                     boolean aInDifferentRequestor,
                                     boolean aSetStatusIfLost,
                                     boolean localCache)
                              throws LockFailureException,
                                     DatabaseException
        Releases a lock.
        Parameters:
        aLockName - key of the lock to release
        requestorId - requestor id whose lock should be released
        aInDifferentRequestor - should we unlock it even if a different Requestor is holding it?
        aSetStatusIfLost - if this is true, then the processing status is set to fail if the lock to release is not there
        localCache - if this is true, then the lock is released from local cache too
        Returns:
        true iff a lock record (expired or not) was deleted and iff aInDifferentRequestor is false (that is, if we know that we deleted a record that corresponded to our Requestor)
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if a connection fails or something goes wrong
        LockGoneException - if the lock is no longer there. If this happens, then the processing status will be set to "fail" iff the aSetStatusIfLost parameter is set to true.
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • unlockAllForOperator

        int unlockAllForOperator(java.lang.String operatorId)
                  throws LockFailureException
        Parameters:
        operatorId - operator id whose locks should be released
        Returns:
        number of previously locked instances that are now unlocked
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • unlockForRequestor

        int unlockForRequestor(java.lang.String requestorId)
                throws LockFailureException
        Parameters:
        requestorId - requestor id whose locks should be released
        Returns:
        number of previously locked instances that are now unlocked
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • releaseSystemLocks

        int releaseSystemLocks()
                throws LockFailureException
        Returns:
        number of previously locked instances that are now released
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • expireRequestorLocks

        java.util.Collection<ILockInformation> expireRequestorLocks(java.lang.String requestorId)
                                                     throws LockFailureException
        When the current requestor times out expire all locks held by him by moving the expiration date to now
        Parameters:
        requestorId - requestor id whose locks should be released
        Returns:
        collection of locks that are expired
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • getLocksInformation

        java.util.Collection<ILockInformation> getLocksInformation()
                                                    throws LockFailureException
        Returns:
        collection of locks that are held currently
        Throws:
        LockFailureException - if there is some other database/hazelcast-related problem

      • withNewExpiration

        ILockInformation withNewExpiration(ILockInformation aLockInformation,
                                   java.util.Date newExpirationTime,
                                   java.util.Date newDBExpirationTime,
                                   java.util.Date newUpdateTime,
                                   java.lang.String aTenantID)
        Create a new lock that is a copy of this lock, except with a new expiration time.
        Parameters:
        aLockInformation - LockInformation to be changed.
        newExpirationTime - Date representing the desired expiration time
        newDBExpirationTime - Date representing the desired db expiration time
        newUpdateTime - Date representing the updatetime
        aTenantID -
        Returns:
        a new LockInformation object
